gov.nasa.gsfc.nisgs.dsm
Class DSMAdministrator

java.lang.Object
  gov.nasa.gsfc.nisgs.dsm.DSM
      gov.nasa.gsfc.nisgs.dsm.DSMAdministrator

public final class DSMAdministrator
extends DSM

DSMAdministrator is an interface class to the DSM subsystem and database. Only DSM agents, servers, and administrative tools should use it. It needs mysql-jdbc.jar.

Version:
3.0 Added support for transfer commands and rollbacks.

Constructor Detail

DSMAdministrator

public DSMAdministrator(java.lang.String myGroup,
                        java.lang.String myName)
                 throws java.lang.Exception
Construct the DSMAdministrator object. It establishes a network connection to the database server. It uses the site and host information passed as properties. See the corresponding DSM constructor for more information.

Parameters:
myGroup - Each program using the DSM should have a unique group name. The DSM uses the group name to mark products so as to keep track of which ones this program has already processed. See reserveProduct(). The DSM does not enforce the uniqueness of a group name.
myName - Each instance of this program should have a unique name to distinguish it from other instances in the same group. The DSM does not enforce uniqueness.
Throws:
java.lang.Exception

DSMAdministrator

public DSMAdministrator(java.lang.String mySite,
                        java.lang.String myGroup,
                        java.lang.String myName,
                        java.lang.String dbhost)
                 throws java.lang.Exception
Construct the DSMAdministrator object. It establishes a network connection to the database server.

Parameters:
mySite - A name for the computer on which this program is running. All DSM-users on the same computer must use the same site name.
myGroup - Each program using the DSM should have a unique group name. The DSM uses the group name to mark products so as to keep track of which ones this program has already processed. See reserveProduct(). The DSM does not enforce the uniqueness of a group name.
myName - Each instance of this program should have a unique name to distinguish it from other instances in the same group. The DSM does not enforce uniqueness.
dbhost - The name of the computer or IP address where the database server resides.
Throws:
java.lang.Exception

storeProduct

public java.lang.String storeProduct(java.lang.String xsite,
                                     Product product)
                              throws java.lang.Exception
Store a product in the database with a specified site name. This allows agents to register products for other computers. The resources must reside on the target site, and the directory names must be valid on the site.

Parameters:
xsite - a valid site name
product - a reference to a Product object.
Returns:
the product ID for this product, which is its primary key.
Throws:
java.lang.Exception

java.lang.Exception

updateProductType

public void updateProductType(ProductType productType)
                       throws java.lang.Exception

java.lang.Exception

getProductTypes

public ProductType[] getProductTypes()
                              throws java.lang.Exception
Get an array of product types. This includes product types that are defined in the Products table but do not have an entry in the ProductTypes table. Each product type contains its keyword list. Undefined product types will be inside ProductType objects but with all fields except name set to null.

Throws:
java.lang.Exception

                               throws java.lang.Exception
Get a list of all passes.

Throws:
java.lang.Exception

createStation

public void createStation(Station station)
                   throws java.lang.Exception
Create a new station and add it to the Stations table. A station entry contains more descriptive information about a station. A product does not require it.

Parameters:
station - a reference to a Station object.
Throws:
java.lang.Exception

deleteStation

public void deleteStation(java.lang.String name)
                   throws java.lang.Exception
Delete a station record from the Stations table. This has no effect on products that refer to stations. Those references will simply have no information in the Stations table.

Parameters:
name - station name
Throws:
java.lang.Exception

                      throws java.lang.Exception

                                      java.lang.String directoryPath,
                                      java.lang.String ancillaryId,
                                      boolean doCommit)
                               throws java.lang.Exception
Update an ancillary site table with a new ancillary file location. This method is used when an ancillary file is copied to another computer.
